description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
 
  Boeing Canada Operations Ltd. is seeking to fill an exciting opportunity for a Senior Program Manager – Boeing Global Services (Non-US Americas) representing Canada, Latin America regions.
 
  This position will be located in Ottawa, Ontario reporting to the Executive Director of Boeing Global Services – Government, for Boeing Defense United Kingdom, Europe, Israel, Canada, and Latin America regions. The role requires leading through influence and partnering with cross-functional teams on program execution, demand planning and forecasting for Canada, Latin America regional programs in the non-US Government portfolio.
 
  We are seeking a multifaceted leader with strategic vision, operational and tactical understanding, and leadership to model the culture of Boeing Global Services as agile and lean, while being deeply committed to the customer and program execution.
 
  Position Responsibility:
 
   Attend Colonel level customer program reviews
   Ensure Program Managers maintain program schedule/ cost goals while leading and directing activities and initiatives that result in new business relationships.
   Driving execution of new and existing integrated offerings to customers, ensuring follow-on extension/awards
   Ensure Program Managers complete the current statement of work and drive growth on new contracts
   Championing change by being intentional and purposeful in communicating a Services-First approach
   Inspiring and leading a comprehensive change management process across new business and using Program Management Best Practices to drive efficiencies
   Work across Boeing Business Units and Functions to shape growth and capture new business opportunities
   Coordinating across functions and programs to ensure a consistent focus on our people, customer, and corporate partners
   Providing customer needs to horizontal leads to ensure successful execution of current and future contracts
 
 
  This position is expected to be 100% onsite. The selected candidate will be required to work onsite at the listed location.
 
  Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status.
 
  Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
 
   Must be legally able to work in Canada.
   10+ Years working within aviation, international business or military experience
   Minimum 4 years working in a senior leadership role
   Minimum 5+ years’ experience with Program Management Best Practices (PMBP)
   Experience working with Government programs
   Experience working with Canadian, Latin American military customers and / or industry
   Must consent to Canadian Government Controlled Goods Program (CGP) assessment.
   Individual must not pose a risk for safeguarding of controlled goods.
   Must be eligible for Secret Level II security clearance.
   Must be eligible to handle US export-controlled data.
 
 
  Preferred Qualifications (Education/Experience):
 
   Post-secondary Education
   Knowledge of the Canadian Government procurement process
   Experience working with Canadian, Central & South American customers and / or industry
   Secret Level II clearance
 
 
  Relocation:
 
  This position does not offer relocation. Candidates must live in the immediate area or relocate at their own expense
 
  Additional Information:
 
  This requisition is for a locally hired position in Canada. The employer is Boeing Canada. Candidates must be legally authorized to work in Canada. Benefits and pay are determined by Canada and are not on Boeing US-based payroll. This is not an expatriate assignment.
 
  This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a secret security clearance Level II from the Canadian government. Requirements to obtain a secret security clearance can be found at:
 
  http://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/personnel/information-eng.html#a1.1
 
  To review the Canadian Controlled Goods and Public Service and Procurement Canada requirements please go to the following government pages below:
 
  https://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/pmc-cgp/enregistrement-register/lignedirectrice-rd-guideline-do-eng.html
 
  https://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/personnel/pdcf-rsrp-eng.html
 
  Export Control Requirements: Not an export control position
  Equal Opportunity Employer:
  We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not accept unlawful discrimination in our recruitment or employment practices on any grounds including but not limited to; race, color, ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military and veteran status, or other characteristics covered by applicable law.
  We have teams in more than 65 countries, and each person plays a role in helping us become one of the world’s most innovative, diverse and inclusive companies. We are proud members of the Valuable 500 and welcome applications from candidates with disabilities. Applicants are encouraged to share with our recruitment team any accommodations required during the recruitment process. Accommodations may include but are not limited to: conducting interviews in accessible locations that accommodate mobility needs, encouraging candidates to bring and use any existing assistive technology such as screen readers and offering flexible interview formats such as virtual or phone interviews.
